name: Longest Consecutive Sequence

title: Longest Consecutive Sequence
content:
Given an unsorted array of integers nums, return the length of the longest consecutive elements sequence.

You must write an algorithm that runs in O(n) time.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [100,4,200,1,3,2]
Output: 4
Explanation: The longest consecutive elements sequence is [1, 2, 3, 4]. Therefore its length is 4.

Example 2:

Input: nums = [0,3,7,2,5,8,4,6,0,1]
Output: 9

Example 3:

Input: nums = [1,0,1,2]
Output: 3

 

Constraints:

  • 0 <= nums.length <= 105
  • -109 <= nums[i] <= 109

discussion_posts.name: user5582eQ
discussion_posts.content: So many solutions here claiming to be O(n) are actually either O(n^2) or O(nlogn). How can people here have such poor understanding of time complexity.

discussion_posts.name: jakubbala
discussion_posts.content: I\'m looking at solutions and as soon as I see "sort" you\'ve failed, its not O(n)

discussion_posts.name: PruthviChippa
discussion_posts.content: this deserves to be hard for o(n)

discussion_posts.name: user7312022
discussion_posts.content:
You can run your code against these test cases before submisson. Hope it helps!

[100,4,200,1,3,2]
[0,3,7,2,5,8,4,6,0,1]
[1,2,0,1]
[0]
[0,0]
[]

discussion_posts.name: iChuan
discussion_posts.content: This is really weried to me. Hard to understand the meaning of this question.

discussion_posts.name: ghoshdipan
discussion_posts.content: How does [1,2,0,1] tc gives output as 3? It should be 2! Someone please clarify.\n[0,1,1,2] -> has at most 2 consecutive nos.

discussion_posts.name: Vithesh
discussion_posts.content:
People forget why this problem is medium.
Everyone can solve this problem in O(nlogn).
But only few people can come up with their own algorithm with O(n) time.

Who is gonna tell them.

discussion_posts.name: Abit_Singh
discussion_posts.content: This question was asked in Google interview.

discussion_posts.name: isadhwani
discussion_posts.content: This is really poorly worded and difficult to understand

discussion_posts.name: forrrjoyuri
discussion_posts.content:
Just for the sake of comparison, I implemented a naive solution in O(n log n) that sorts the array.
My solution runs in 9ms. I copypasted the best linear solutions from the top posts here and the best i got was 30ms.

In theory, something is wrong here. Why is it the case ?
